title: Sparita la colonna "Oggetto" dalla "Posta in arrivo" unificata
content: Ciao, è sparito da un po' di tempo la colonna "Oggetto" dalla Posta in arrivo unificata. E' veramente assurdo, perché ho 4 caselle mail e se vado su ognuna di esse singolarmente c'è tutto regolarmente, mentre nella posta in arrivo che le unifica manca il campo Oggetto, con le ovvie terribili conseguenze. Ho provato di tutto ma non riesco a ripristinarla. La cosa più assurda è che andando in alto a destra sul bottone "Seleziona le colonne da mostrare" (nella foto, la freccia di destra) me ne dà ben 21 diverse, da "seleziona messaggi" a "ordine di ricezione", tranne appunto quella "Oggetto". Le ho provate davvero tutte, anche "mostra come nella cartella x", tranne reinstallare Thunderbird, perché tra le altre cose ho diversi GB di cartelle locali di archivio. Possibile che non ci sia un modo per sistemare una cosa apparentemente così stupida? Help me, please! Grazie
creator: RaroZero

title: Problema con certificati auto firmati - Linuxo 19.1
content:
Buongiorno a tutti. Ho un problema che non riesco a risolvere da qualche mese.

Lo scenario è questo: - diversi client con sistema operativo Linux Mint 21.1 o 19.1 o Ubuntu/Kde, Thunderbird di varie versioni piuttosto recenti, la più recente è la 102.7.1 e due pc più vecchi che non uso dove la versione più vecchia è la 68.10.0 - server di posta interno con ubuntu 16.04, postfix, dovecot

Sulle versioni più vecchie tutto funziona, su quelle nuove, non c'è modo di connettersi utilizzando una connessione sicura. Sulle versioni vecchie se reimposto un account Thunderbird mi chiede di accettare l'eccezione relativa al certificato del server (che è generato da me e self-signed, aggiornato e in funzione da anni) invece sulle nuove versioni mi segnala di essere connesso ma non chiede nulla e non carica le cartelle dal server. I log lato server mi confermano l'avvenuta connessione del client e null'altro.

Con altri client come Evolution o K-9 Mail (android) non ho nessun problema. Qualcuno di voi ha lo stesso problema? Grazie.

Paolo
creator: paolo.biraghi

creator: bjsantos

title: Set default font color for e-mail messages.
content:
I write my e-mails in a green font. That is how I used to do it in Outlook and as soon as I started writing it stayed as green after setting it up. However I haven't found a way to do that in Thunderbird that is satisfactory. The main way I see mentioned is changing the setting in Composition > HTML Style > Take out use reader's colors and set green as text, however this also changes the color of the Thunderbird signature and of the messages being replied. My wish is to only make green whatever I write for the message, not the full e-mail. Is there a way to set it to a color?

If this setting isn't in standard Thunderbird a plugin suggestion would also work! What I wish would be equivalent to having the green font color selected at the start of any e-mail with everything else default!

Many thanks,

Kael
creator: kael10

title: PROBLEMA DE HORÁRIO NA AGENDA - BRASIL (UTC -03:00)
content:
Olá! Tudo bem?

Estou com uma questão de sincronização de agenda entre Thunderbird e Outlook.

Quando crio um evento/reunião através do Thunderbird e dentre os convidados há alguém que possua a ferramenta (aplicação) Outlook em seu computador, o horário da reunião vai errado, na verdade, com exata 1 hora de diferença.

Como se alguma configuração dentro da ferramenta ainda estivesse com horário de verão que não existe mais no Brasil por enquanto.

Se eu criar um evento para às 15 horas (03 p.m.), na aplicação do Outlook eu recebo como se fosse para às 14 horas (02 p.m.).

Fiz alguns testes para tentar identificar e essa questão ocorre somente quando a Origem é Thunderbird para Outlook (aplicação).

Demais testes que não replicaram o problema: - Thunderbird para Thunderbird = OK; - Thunderbird para Gmail (Web) = OK; - Thunderbird para Outlook (Web) = OK; - Outlook para Outlook = OK; - Outlook para Thunderbird = OK; - Outlook para Gmail (web) = OK; - eMClient para Outlook = OK; - eMClient para Thunderbird = OK;
creator: william81

title: Thunderbird stop writing to local storage.
content:
I recently start receiving error: "The messages could not be moved or copied to folder 'Amazon on Local Folders' because writing to folder failed. To gain disk space, from the File menu, first choose Empty Trash, and then choose Compact Folders, and then try again." for all email moves to local folders.

Windows 10 OS build 19044.2546 Thunderbird 102.7.1 (64 bit)

Compact and empty trash - no change. Downgrade version - no change. Totally uninstall and reinstall - no change. Plenty of disk, but current local was large, so: Created empty local folder on system disk - same. Created dummy pop account (not attached to a server) new so 'empty' - same. check disk - no problems found.

Since I tried various target drives, folder/accounts, doesn't seem to be a profile issue, but with complete uninstall/install won't think it's an application issue, so ??? Also, occurred when downgraded to version I know was working.

In process of moving profile from Windows to Mac - will take a bit, so results pending...
creator: Paul.M.Erickson

title: Thunderbird Sending of the message failed.Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com.
content:
Effective yesterday, I started to receive the following error message when trying to send and emails using Microsoft email account:

Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'.

I verified SMTP Settings; they are correct and are as follows:

Server Name: smtp.office365.com Port: 587 Connection Security: STARTTLS Authentication Method: OAuth2 User Name: complete email account

I am having this identical error occurring on multiple Microsoft email accounts installed in Thunderbird, on the same computer. I uninstalled and reinstalled each email account and continue to receive the same error message on each email account.

Currently Installed Version of Thunderbird: 110.0b3 (64-bit)

Operating System: Windows Edition: Windows 11 Pro Version: 22H2 Installed on: 11/8/2022 OS Build: 22621.1194

The following was the last Update Installed on February 4, 2023, from Microsoft: 2023-01 Cumulative Update Preview for .NET Framework 3.5 and 4.8.1 for Windows 11, version 22H2 for x64 (KB5022404)

Please advise
creator: oggvorf

title: Unable to make Addres Book entry edits persist
content:
Is anybody else experiencing issue trying to edit existing Address Book entries in Thunderbird 102.7.1 on Windows 10? I open an address entry to edit, and in this case, delete a second address entry where "United States of America" somehow found its way into the Street Address field on a Work address (the only entry in that address). I can delete the entry, press Tab, Save, and in the summary, it is initially gone, then pops right back up after about a second. I can also set the address to None while editing as well, to no effect.

This address book app looks like it is reused code from a failed startup designed and written when Windows 3.0 was all the rage.

I do use TBsync (you know, a THIRD PARTY add-on, to sync the address book <roll eyes>), but even with that turned off, the same thing occurs, so that is not the issue.

And... it's not everything. For example, I can edit the STATE and that will stick. But, try to eliminate a Notes entry? Not happening. It initially is gone as soon as I save the edit, but a second later, it pops right back up on the summary screen. So, at least trying to eliminate an address entry and a Notes entry doesn't work.

Anybody else?
creator: 907shane

title: Email Print radically different from display
content:
Hi Team, This issue of rendering to print has been around for a while, but I thought I'd bring up. A Newsletter I receive sometimes shows a poll result (see image; Screen Newsletter Poll Result) It looks like it is done by stretching an image to fit the ratio.

… I pulled that code for one of the bars from the "View Source" option.

In Print though, it looks quite different (see image; Print Newsletter Poll Result 1 page only) The first bar takes up 5 pages. The image, POLL_bars_blue.jpg, is 1×20px, so why Thunderbird renders it to 5 pages deep rather than just 20px did make me wonder.

Does anyone have a clue? Can it be constrained somehow?
creator: compass_drg

title: Sharing files from windows 10 Explorer via mail using Thunderbird
content: I have used Thunderbird for years and until recently have never had problems with sharing files from Win 10 Explorer via Mail with Thunderbird 102.7.7 64bit as my default Mail app. Recently however whenever I select a file in Explorer to 'share' the email icon does not become 'live'. Other icons are active. I am therefore unable to email a file. I have seen a mention somewhere that it might be possible to cure this issue by uninstalling and reinstalling Thunderbird - if that is the solution then how do I preserve all the emails in my current application? Your advice would be appreciated. Dave Hayward

title: Folders behavior customization?
content:
Hey guys. With my previous Tbird install, subfolders had 3 different looks to them. There was a folder icon for subfolders with no unread emails, and other icon for folders with unread emails, and an other subfolder icon for a subfolder with new unread email. But the image included shows the new updated version folders I get. The subfolder "HODL" and the subfolder "Interac" look identical, though one of them contains unread emails (4) and the other one does not.

This is a very important feature for my script to work properly. I can't find where in the settings or with add-ons how to make it so.

This is likely frivolous to most of you, but extremely important to me.

How can I get subfolders with unread emails to look different?

Or maybe I could revert to the earlier version?

title: Problema invio mail
content: Buongiorno, spesso quando tento di inviare una mail si blocca al 100% e non riesce a far uscire la mail. Come annullo l'invio mi dice che non riesce ad autenticarsi al server di gmail, ma i dati sono corretti. Devo ogni volta salvare la mail in bozze, riavviare thunderbird e poi la mail esce senza problemi. Questa cosa si ripete anche 10 volte al giorno. Ho provato a dare uno sguardo al registro degli errori e l'unica cosa che vedo è questo: "uncaught exception: 2147500036". Non ho idea del significato e non riesco a riprodurre sistematicamente l'errore in quanto si ripresenta, apparentemente, in modo casuale. La versione di thunderbird è la 102.6.1 64bit, windows 11 e account gmail. Nessun componente aggiuntivo. Se serve altro per identificare il problema sono a disposizione. Grazie mille.
creator: cristiano.pusceddu
